issue.title: ##ticket.date## does not use timezone configured
issue.body:
### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Version

10.0.10

### Bug description

While using ##ticket.date## in mail notifications date is not using the correct timezone configured in GLPI system.

I search over the code and I believe the problem is in the Html::convDate function being called, this function creates a new Datetime just passing the time but no timezone is given.
```
  try {
            $date = new \DateTime($time);
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
           ErrorHandler::getInstance()->handleException($e);
            Session::addMessageAfterRedirect(
                sprintf(
                    __('%1$s %2$s'),
                    $time,
                    _x('adjective', 'Invalid')
                )
            );
            return $time;
        }
```

While using timelineitems.date date is correct, i looked in the code and I believe that it just returns the datetime stored in the database.

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Page URL

_No response_

### Steps To reproduce

1. Create a notification with the following content:

```
##FOREACH last 2 tasks##
[##task.date##] ##task.author##
##lang.task.description## ##task.description##
##ENDFOREACHtasks##
```
2. Create the ticket and use the event configured.
3. Check your mail, task.date shows as UTC (+0).

issue.title: Blank/White screen after adding a device
issue.body:
### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Version

10.0.9

### Bug description

Creating an issue. I want to add a device in the Devices category, so i add it. When i finish the issue by pressing the Add button, the website goes blank white. Pressing back in the browser doesn't go back, unless it is pressed fast and multiple times.

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Page URL

glpi/front/ticket.form.php

### Steps To reproduce

1. Start creating an Issue and input all the necesarry information
2. Add a device in the Devices menu/list
3. Press "Add" to submit the Issue
4. the self hosted GLPI website goes blank


### Your GLPI setup information

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

comment.body: Since we do not reproduce, I consider the issue is fixed. Fell free to reopen if you reproduce with latest stable release (do not wait for .11 to be released to test .10...).

pull_request.title: `getTableForItemType()` must support `CommonDBTM::getTable()` overrides
pull_request.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Bug fix?      | yes
| New feature?  | no
| BC breaks?    | no
| Deprecations? | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed tickets | -

Currently, when a class overrides `CommonDBTM::getTable()` to force usage of a specific table, this override is not reflected in `getTableForItemType()` results. It does not seems to produce issues for now because overrides are not used for assets yet, but there are lots of usages of `getTableForItemType()` that would fail if someones push into `$CFG_GLPI['xxx_types']` a class that overrides the `CommonDBTM::getTable()` method. For instance, in #15729 , I figured out that many pieces of code were failing.

Replacing all usages of `getTableForItemType()` by `$itemtype::getTable()` is not really an option, at least in a short term. First, it would be a pain, there are hundreds of usages of it, and we may miss some occurences. Second, it would require a deprecation phase, so we would still have to fix the `getTableForItemType()` results.

Before:
```php
getTableForItemType('RuleTicket'); // glpi_ruletickets
RuleTicket::getTable(); // glpi_rules
```

After:
```php
getTableForItemType('RuleTicket'); // glpi_rules
RuleTicket::getTable(); // glpi_rules
```

issue.title: Telemetry ajax URL requires login
issue.body:
### Code of Conduct

- [ ] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [ ] I have searched the existing issues

### Version

10.0.10

### Bug description

When installing, button that would show what is sent to telemetry call a protected URL; but we're not logged in at this point.

We're redirected to login page; but install is not yet really finished.

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Page URL

_No response_

### Steps To reproduce

_No response_

### Your GLPI setup information

_No response_

_No response_

issue.title: Issue with sockets access
issue.body:
### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Version

10.0.10

### Bug description

When accessing an existing "socket" the page socket "area" is blank
When I have my debug mode on, it gives me this error : 

`Uncaught Exception RuntimeException: Unable to retrieve itemtype in /home/glpi/public_html/src/Socket.php at line 196`

![image](https://github.com/glpi-project/glpi/assets/48074916/7e31401c-712c-4336-899d-88cbf303d758)


### Relevant log output

```shell
[2023-10-26 11:44:32] glpiphplog.CRITICAL:   *** Uncaught Exception RuntimeException: Unable to retrieve itemtype in /home/glpi/public_html/src/Socket.php at line 196
  Backtrace :
  src/CommonGLPI.php:677                             Glpi\Socket->showForm()
  ajax/common.tabs.php:116                           CommonGLPI::displayStandardTab()
```


### Page URL

front/socket.form.php?id=11

Create a socket in cables
Try to access it afterwards
The error appears (in debug)

issue.title: Issue with sockets access
issue.body:
### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Version

10.0.10

### Bug description

When accessing an existing "socket" the page socket "area" is blank
When I have my debug mode on, it gives me this error : 

`Uncaught Exception RuntimeException: Unable to retrieve itemtype in /home/glpi/public_html/src/Socket.php at line 196`

![image](https://github.com/glpi-project/glpi/assets/48074916/7e31401c-712c-4336-899d-88cbf303d758)

```shell
[2023-10-26 11:44:32] glpiphplog.CRITICAL:   *** Uncaught Exception RuntimeException: Unable to retrieve itemtype in /home/glpi/public_html/src/Socket.php at line 196
  Backtrace :
  src/CommonGLPI.php:677                             Glpi\Socket->showForm()
  ajax/common.tabs.php:116                           CommonGLPI::displayStandardTab()
```


### Page URL

front/socket.form.php?id=11

### Steps To reproduce

Create a socket in cables
Try to access it afterwards
The error appears (in debug)

commits.message: Add base fields and register in common asset types configs
Fix filtering assets in content templates rendering
fix criteria on rule import asset

Deprecate (non strict) usage of raw SQL in iterator (#15867)

* Deprecate (non strict) usage of raw SQL in iterator

* Update src/DBmysqlIterator.php

* Apply suggestions from code review

* Revert "Apply suggestions from code review"

This reverts commit 8202a8f32a66f86ab2bd63c84aac69a85de27f65.

* Revert "Update src/DBmysqlIterator.php"

This reverts commit cca3db1a116d879f9d4ab47db184ae33328949a9.

* Change depreciation message

---------

Co-authored-by: Cédric Anne <cedric.anne@gmail.com>

pull_request.title: Deprecate (non strict) usage of raw SQL in iterator
pull_request.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Bug fix?      | no
| New feature?  | no
| BC breaks?    | kind of
| Deprecations? | no
| Tests pass?   | yes

I'm almost sure this has not been handled in main.

I've always considered that was an mistake; fortunately this is not widely used in core code. Depreciation is not strict, unless constant is set (like in test suite).

repo.name: glpi
repo.description: GLPi stands for Gestionnaire Libre de Parc Informatique is a Free Asset and IT Management Software package, that provides ITIL Service Desk features, licenses tracking and software auditing.

repo.description: GLPI is a Free Asset and IT Management Software package, Data center management, ITIL Service Desk, licenses tracking and software auditing.
